website_summaries.verdict: A knitting machine was originally just a loom, and this set of looms is very useful - and extremely affordable.
pros: It is just a set of looms rather than a machine per se, but this is a very useful and inexpensive kit that is a must for knitters
cons: Pretty basic stuff here, but that is offset by its easy of use and downright utility

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Im loom obsessed
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!!! My friends are amazed I am making hats and scarfs and headbands in an hour or two. I had zero knowledge in knitting and wanted a hobby. I have zero talent in the arts and I can loom with ease!! Would recommend to everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: So, I got these for making hats and I like them. I'd call them a "beginner's set". Pros: They're strong plastic looms They are basic so most patterns online will work with it Four different sizes including kid's and infant hat sizes Cons: The plastic is not durable and I already broke a peg The knitting instructions were really confusing The knitting tools are NOT durable. I've already had to purchase a new knitting needle. I would recommend this loom set for new knitters. There are lots of tutorials online and I have made several hats. I want some more looms (maybe a little more durable).
customer_reviews.author: London

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my! The Loom that started it all! Haha I never loomed, never knitted before and I bought this and knit like crazy! So many YouTube videos out there to help! Look up Round Loom knitting. I make charity hats now! I made a baby cap for my upcoming 4th grandbaby! It’s easy-peasy and fun! It helps keep the place. Men or women or kids can do this. You can round Loom even blankets, cloths, socks, sky is the limit. This set is very sturdy! Very thick! I really love that! Great price!
customer_reviews.author: Bibers Violin

customer_reviews.title: Broken peg on blue and green looms, hook slipped out of rubber
customer_reviews.text: The loom was good for 2 projects then the pegs come off and I'm not casting super tight or anything. The hook started rotating in use and eventually slipped right out the sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: Maria V.

customer_reviews.title: Need an in-between size for older children.
customer_reviews.text: I love the loom set and am trying to make hats for kids for charity. These would be grade school kids and I just completed a childs hat on the green loom. Please make another loom in-between the green and orange. There is a big jump between those two and some kids have more hair and the little green loom is small. I used two stands of No 4 Lion Brand Yarn (very good yarn) and it will not fit all size lower grade children. I am very disappointed. The hat turned out great with the knitted-in brim. I love the looms, just need one more for a little large size childs hat. Thank You. I would order it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy  Williams

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this after my mother in law showed me how and immediately was able to make a hat and scarf. I have never been a knitter and crocheting gave me carpal tunnel so it was great to discover this tool. I finally have a use for all the yarn I create by spinning wool into yarn and can now make lots of warm hats for the homeless. You can see that it looks pretty good for the first time use with homespun yarn.
customer_reviews.author: Sarouche

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great set of looms. I use the orange one to make beanies but you can also use them to make other things like blankets, small towels and even scarfs. You just have to look up how to do it on a circular loom. The hook and needle are easy to use, especially the hook since its pretty sharp. Every loom came with pegs attached, I know some people had that problem but my came nicely packaged and it came in a clear plastic zip up bag to store them in.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: This is such a good deal for good quality looms
customer_reviews.text: This set is amazing. If you go to stores like Walmart, Target or Kmart, you will leave with most likely the two smaller looms, each one costing about 10-13 dollars. Big craft places like Michaels sells them for like 15, and the bigger looms for 20+ dollars. For less than 20 dollars, you get 4 looms, a guide and a hook, that is an amazing deal. I know this sounds cheesy, but its true, most places that sell looms individually charge 10+ dollars, but then this deal saved me so much cash. I love my looms.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance ordering these, because I saw how cheap they were. I've recently started knitting as a hobby, and I saw this was so affordable and it had good reviews so I bought it. It arrived early and in good condition. I've been using them for the past couple of days and made several projects. They're suprisingly sturdy, and easy to hold! If you're considering buying these, I'd say go for it. They're well priced and perfect for projects.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice!

customer_reviews.title: Good looms, bad hook

It does not have an ergonomically designed handle (pretty important) and the wire of the hook itself is too large. I would throw this hook away and buy one, either from Boye, which is an excellent hook, or a more expensive one from the makers of the Knifty Knitter.
